TITLE GOES HERE: Without using jargon, describe what a receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve is and why it is important in predictive analytics and machine learning.

 <!--begin-answer-->

A ROC curve can be used to describe the performance of a binary classifier.
This is important in predictive analytics and machine learning because there are various thresholds that can be set for the classifier.

For more information see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Receiver_operating_characteristic

 <!--end-answer-->
